name: Robinson
culturalSignificance: The name Robinson has been historically significant in English-speaking countries, often associated with the famous literary character Robinson Crusoe. It is a patronymic surname, meaning 'son of Robin,' and has been borne by notable figures in various fields, contributing to its recognition and cultural importance.
modernContext: In 2024-2025, Robinson remains a recognizable surname and occasionally used as a first name. It is more commonly seen in surnames, maintaining its traditional roots, but is appreciated for its classic and strong sound.
literaryReferences: Robinson Crusoe, the protagonist of Daniel Defoe's novel, is one of the most famous literary characters with this name, symbolizing adventure and survival.
personality: People named Robinson are often perceived as adventurous, independent, and resilient, reflecting the traits of the famous literary character Robinson Crusoe.
symbolism: The name Robinson symbolizes resilience, exploration, and self-reliance, largely due to its association with the character Robinson Crusoe.
funFact: Robinson Crusoe, published in 1719, is often credited as one of the first English novels, and its protagonist's name has become synonymous with survival stories.

achievements: First African American to play in Major League Baseball in the modern era
Helped to end racial segregation in professional baseball
historicFigures.significance: Jackie Robinson broke the baseball color line when he started at first base for the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947, becoming a symbol of racial integration in sports.
notableWorks: Major League Baseball debut with Brooklyn Dodgers
Induction into the Baseball Hall of Fame

achievements: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights
historicFigures.significance: Mary Robinson was the first woman to hold the office of President of Ireland, serving from 1990 to 1997, and later became a prominent advocate for human rights globally.
notableWorks: Role as UN High Commissioner for Human Rights

achievements: Regarded as one of the greatest boxers of all time
Won the world welterweight and middleweight titles
historicFigures.significance: Sugar Ray Robinson is considered one of the greatest boxers in history, known for his outstanding skills and charisma in the ring.

achievements: Starred in classic films such as 'Little Caesar' and 'Double Indemnity'
historicFigures.significance: Edward G. Robinson was a prominent actor known for his roles in gangster films during Hollywood's Golden Age.
Joan Robinson was a significant figure in the field of economics, known for her contributions to economic theory and her work on imperfect competition.
notableWorks: Introduction of the concept of monopsony

songs.title: Mrs. Robinson
songs.quote: Here's to you, Mrs. Robinson, Jesus loves you more than you will know.

famousQuotes.quote: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
famousQuotes.context: This quote reflects Robinson's belief in the significance of contributing positively to society and the lives of others.

famousPeople.name: Smokey Robinson
knownFor: Hits like 'Tears of a Clown' and 'Tracks of My Tears'

famousPeople.name: Craig Robinson
knownFor: Role as Darryl Philbin on 'The Office'

moviesAndShows.title: The Graduate
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: An older woman who seduces the protagonist, Benjamin Braddock.

moviesAndShows.title: Lost in Space
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: The father and leader of the Robinson family, who are stranded in space.

characterQuotes.quoteSummary: You're trying to seduce me, aren't you?
characterQuotes.context: This iconic line is delivered by Benjamin Braddock, highlighting the tension and humor in his relationship with Mrs. Robinson.
